titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Albert Rees Papers, 1966-1992 and undated RL.01076
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Kirk White, Sandeep Mody, and Paula Jeannet; machine-readable finding aid created by: Paula Jeannet and Lisa Stark

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-01-08 16:13:14 UTC.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Portions of the collection are restricted.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Albert Rees Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Albert Rees Papers were received as a gift to the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library in 1993.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Kirk White, Sandeep Mody, and Paula Jeannet
Encoded by Paula Jeannet and Lisa Stark

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Economics professor and administrator at Princeton University. Headed Gerald Ford's Council on Wage and Price Stability.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains correspondence, lectures, writings, and course notes. There is testimony involving a union dispute. Some correspondence is divided by name of correspondent.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access is restricted; for more details, please see the reference staff of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence. Other section from A-H can be found at end of Box 3.
